lexUnit.name: work.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: do work, especially as one's job.

sentence.text: The 450,000 employees , 300,000 of whom work in the postal service , are unhappy .
Eighty thousand employees work for foreign-owned companies in the region such as Hewlett Packard , Caterpillar , ICI and Unilever .
First we worked abroad , then his father died , then my husband changed jobs and wanted to settle in .
Mike has also worked abroad in Denmark and more recently in Portugal , setting up a new carpet factory .
BR has had to rely on staff working excessive overtime to carry out maintenance and repair work .
The public relations boys had to work overtime again .
Officers are working huge amounts of overtime and they are not being paid for it .
The practice of nurses working flexible hours , which is largely controlled by the needs of the nursing team , has to date been given little attention .
In earlier times many miners had worked only a part of their time digging coal ; the rest of their income came from labouring jobs or from a smallholding .
The most crucial evidence of the day came from Mr Loxton , who worked as a butcher next door to the Oliver 's shop .
He works as a driver for an electric animal vet .
He worked as an assistant to George Porter , starting his own practice in London in 1838 .
The incident happened in February last year , while Frak was working at the Ashbury Lodge Nursing Home in Marlborough Road in Swindon .
` I 'm going to come and work at the school , " said Maisie .
You remember when I worked for Kayser-Bondor ?
He had worked in the country for 27 years .
My father worked in a market and he got big bundles of it very cheaply .
Readers , especially those just out of college with hardly any prior work experience , are encouraged to contact Mr . Jordan 's Washington office for similar job placement assistance .
